title: Star guardian minisite is obliterating my CPU (firefox)
body:
site takes about 5 minutes to load, freezing my computer in the process. Remains almost unusable after loading.
https://i.gyazo.com/5f371cba4ba1350b351c445106662d6b.png

It lags noticeably, but nowhere near as badly in internet explorer (10-25% cpu, 250mb ram)

windows 7, Firefox 48.0.2 32-bit, intel i3-2100 dual-core CPU, 2x4GB corsair DDR3 ram

replies.body:
Hardly. It never bottlenecks the system while running intensive processing or servers. CPUs are highly overrated for home/gaming computers.
If i ever meet a program that can actually lag it, i will upgrade it. So far i never have.

Even on my i5-6600k@4.5Ghz it takes up to 25% of my CPU time (avg. ~17%), which is a bit extreme. They should have used more GPU rendering (Don't know if it's the Browsers fault or Riots, but I think both could have done better) as it barely uses my GPU (only ~10%)
Isn't lagging on any of my PCs or laptops, at all o.o

It was the same deal for the project event, for some reason they're just horribly optimized.
I have an i7 4770k and it still uses about 15%.
Yeah, the site was terrible on my laptop as well.
